A typical Gacha p#rn game with simple gameplay (the game developers responded to me, thanks).
Otherwise, it's an acquired taste.

Lots of waifus to get. Some are seriously hard to get, some are easier. Mechanics are clean and rewarding. Sound design is good. Story is meh. The game will reach into your wallet at some point. Receives updates regularly.

(FYI, if you're trying to cash in on the promo codes, you can't do that until level 15, where it's unlocked right alongside a bunch of other P2W stuff. The game and the fanbase both fail to mention this. Referral codes are available right away though.)

It's okay. I'm sure you'll quickly slam headfirst into a "pay or grind for 1000 hours" wall like everything else Nutaku touches, considering the gazillion shop items and deals you get slapped in your face that wont matter after a while anyway since the game works on a season system to endlessly milk a gazillion dollars out of a bunch of whales.
Porn's pay/grindwalled, lots of lewd outfits are pay/grindwalled, and so on.

As for the gameplay, it's another one of those simple autobattler things with all the R/SR/SR++++ whatevers.
The only things keeping me from rating this game down is that it's very obviously a money hole and it's not entirely being that secretive about it (so if you're spending tons of money, it's YOUR fault), and the boobs are really big.
Trust me, those milkers visibly SLOSH, it's one of the things this game actually put effort into more than a lot of other games like this.
Can't speak for the actual sex scenes or any of the paywalled stuff, but there's plenty of eye candy even if you're not unlocking that stuff, (it's not like League of Maidens where the devs lock EVERYTHING up and you're stuck in fully-covered bodysuits, no nudity, no sex, no nothing until you pay. God I wish literally anyone else made LoM, so much potential wasted.)

I honestly probably shouldn't rate this up because it's 100% a game meant to drain you of hundreds/thousands of dollars in a heartbeat, but... boobs man. Boobs.
Unfortunately I do find myself playing this only for the gambling aspect.

Being player of this game for 1 year it feels so fast now i got most many characters that you gotta work hard to get them and some H Scenes. But i dont recommend spending money on this beside its clear p2w but its up to you to decide u gonna spend or not this is my opinion. <3
Like a lot of these f2p games it could be great but it is grindy and always wants you to buy more. This being said you can just ignore the paid stuff and play with the free stuff.

I typically don`t enjoy Japanese games because I don`t like those girls who look 12. This game has normal bodied adult women with ample breasts - save for a character called Aruna or Rynasomething but even she looks normal and doesn`t make me feel like a degenerate for playing this.

Aeons Echo is an ambitious role-playing adventure that succeeds in blending classical mythology with a sleek, compelling cyber-futuristic setting. The game immediately captures attention with its unique premise: embarking on a critical mission to save Zeus while navigating a world populated by boldly designed goddesses and mature thematic content.

What I appreciate most is the deep investment in character development through robust dating sim elements. These features allow players to build meaningful, interactive relationships with the diverse cast, making the narrative connections feel rewarding and personal. Coupled with multiple gameplay modes, Aeons Echo offers considerable depth, ensuring that the central RPG questâ€”saving the head of Olympusâ€”is supported by engaging side stories and interactive features. The overall presentation is sharp, successfully delivering a unique, mature visual novel experience.

While the mature themes are certainly central to the experience, the occasional distraction from the main narrative thread by the exhaustive character routes is the only minor point of consideration.
The game is more fun than I expected it to be, I went in expecting it to be a quick "let's check it out" then uninstall, but I've enjoyed playing it beyond the reason for my original install.
I  am new to this type of gaming. I cannot figure the controls. It says it will not work with my xbox conntroller.
Quite a cool toy, for killing time, not obtrusive, there is a plot, quite interesting, if you throw away the erotica and do not pay attention to it, then it is completely interesting!

The good thing about this is you can lay back and not think about it too much. No pressure with decision or other bullshit. You can`t really lose items or miss scenes because you pushed the wrong button at decision time.
Characters look like the ones from Fate Trigger so I will be playing this until that comes out.

negative.review:
TLDR:
There is an actual story that actually has some nice ideas here and there, the artwork is all very nice, the girls are all unique, there are plenty of ways of improving your team, there are plenty of things to do each day, but without taking excessively long to the point it starts to feel like a chore, the interface is not the worst. It's a shame the new player experience/tutorial is so horrendously awful that I imagine most players will probably quit long before they finish them.
If you either follow a guide so you do everything right for your first three months of playing, or just accept that you have missed out on several permanently-missable skins and power buffs, then it's a good NSFW idle auto-battler... that I do not recommend.


Overview

Story
The game has a story - it's an "amnesiac protagonist is suddenly in a harem world" as is expected for a NSFW idle game, but there is a lot of story there, and it has some good ideas and funny moments, and keeps moving and changing at a pretty good pace.
There's plenty to not like though, most notably the SA/rape and crossdressing aspects though (yes, really).

Combat
Combat is a 6x6 idle auto-battler. You set up your formation and your girls fight their girls.
Each girl has various stats, bonuses for being in formation with specific other girls, and there are goddesses that you can use alongside your formation.
Each girl in your team can also be upgraded in various ways (star level, rarity, gear, etc.) and there are other ways to buff your team.
There's a lot of ways to upgrade your girls, and the combat can be as simple as using the 6 girls you like the most, or you can give your formation a lot of thought to get the best possible team, so overall it feels like a decent combat system.

Also note that since each charater skin gives you a decent boost in power, whales who buy skins will be more powerful than f2p players, and since combat power determines turn order, whales will just outspeed and destroy f2p players, so the top of the PvP leaderboards are for whales only.
Thankfully whilst there are several f2p modes, you can still do decently well as an f2p (probably due to each server having a low population, probably due to the awful new player experience) and whilst you get more rewards the better you do, the difference in PvP rewards isn't much in the grand scheme of things.


NSFW
The game does have a lot of NSFW artwork in it, and almost all of it is animated to at least some extent.
The artwork is all very nice, and there is a wide variety of body types and poses to suit your preference.
You unlock quite a lot of scenes from the main story, you can view each girl on the games homescreen, there's usually an event going on that has some eye-candy as a reward.
Overall it's an extremel sexualized game, as expected for something that was originally on Nutaku.
(The Nutaku version is the same in terms of NSFW, but is ahead on content, so it has more girls available. The two versions can't crossplay or interact at all.)

Idle game
There are many things you can do each day - Play mini games, talk to Lilin, do some story, collect idle rewards from Styx, do Giant's Armory, do the PvP arenas, [if you log in at the right time each day] do guild events, maybe do some story, do some collections or pulls for the current event.
There's quite a lot to do, but it doesn't take an annoying or problematic amount of time, but it still feels like you are making a decent amount of progress each day.
Overall I'd say it's a pretty good idle game, albeit one that requires quite a lot of clicking.

Events
As above, the game always has several events running.
These vary considerably, but usually are either summoning for a new girl/skin, or a "do tasks to get rewards" type.
If you are f2p, you will never complete any of these events without many literal months of grinding resources.
Realistically, the only skins you will get as an f2p player are the three skins the game gives you for completing the newbie events that occur at the beginning of the game.
When you start the game you will immediately be given two events: "Newbie Event", which lasts 7 days, and "Aeon Rally - Eternal"
The Newbie Event is the games tutorial, and you should make sure you are doing everything in that event, as most of the things it wants you to do (advance your Aeons, improve gear, improve your horoscope, level up your Apostle, etc) are all things that are critical to improving in the game, and you get a unique skin for Perseus if you complete enough tasks (you need 280 out of 295 points). This skin gives you a permanent power boost for owning it, and is permanently missable.
Once the Newbie Event ends you get the "14-Day Carnival" event, which is basically more of the same tasks.

The "Aeon Rally - Eternal" event gives you points for improving the rarity of your Aeons, with Corona Stones (i.e. Premium currency) for meeting certain milestones, and if you complete 2,500 points in time then you get a unique skin for Sphinx, which again gives you a permanent boost for owning it and is permanently missable.
Once Aeon Rally - Eternal ends, "Eternal Rally - Tennis Player" starts, which gives you a skin for Hypnos, which again, gives a power boost to your entire team and is permanently missable. The Hypnos event lasts 3 months.
The Sphinx skin is pretty difficult to do, and the Hypnos skin is very difficult to get unless you know exactly what you are doing, and both events generally require you to go for that skin only, only spending what you need, and buying up useful items from pretty much the moment you start playing.
If you play well (only buy what you need, always reclaim the energy itmem from the daily Andromeda event, complete all the event objectives as quickly as you can, don't lag behind in any area) you'll get them, but if you don't then you'll miss them.
Having fours events that basically require you to play very well right from the moment you start playing, or else miss permanently missable skins/power boosts is extremely poor game design, especially since those are the only skins you can reliably get as an f2p player.
It is often said on the games dicord that if you can't complete the Newbie event to get the Perseus skin then you should just start again on a different server so you can get it now that you know what to do, and the same is kinda true about the Sphinx skin too - they are permanent boosts that you can never get again, so if you actually want to play the game long-term then you should make the effort to get them whilst you can.
Personally, I image a lot of people will simply start the game, not play perfectly, fail the Newbie event, then see the 14-Day event and see they will fail that too, and just stop playing.
I also imagine there are many people who fail the Newbie event, look up a guide, start on a new server, complete the Newbie event, fail the Sphinx event, and then quit the game.


Aeons Echo is a good idle game, and a very good NSFW game.
If the skins from the beginner events were either not permanently missable, or the events were much easier, then I would happily recommend the game, but as it stands I just can't recommend a game that has a new player experience that is this bad.

It's a P2W game. Not worth playing at all unless you want to drop hundreds of dollars in it to progress. Even if you did that, within a week you'll be behind again and need to spend more money to catch up. Everything about this game is a money grab.

The game finds about a hundred ways to waste my time with banal notifications that ultimately mean fuck all, since each one triggers 2 more things I have to go unlock and accept... and claim, and collect rewards, but none of it is worth anything. 7 summon banners? Really? And each one has a special currency that you get a single one of per day? 2 banners need incrementally increased costs, so... what's even the point? I'm not spending money on this, so you can just keep dreaming. Genuinely zero reason to pay anything for these cheap AI images of the same character, sporting a different snap-on head. Streamline this crap, or my interest will fall right off. I already didn't play for almost a week, and barely noticed. 

Red dot notifications often don't go away, since they're just flicking you in dick to spend money to make them go away. That shit is astoundingly frustrating. Even if you're coming here for some hentai (fucking... why? You're on the internet, you can look up whatever you want for free) the 18+ is even made tedious with loading times between dialogue options. Every aspect of this game is weighed down in SLOG, like trudging waist-deep through honey.
Gatcha style chain mail bikini fighting that stops you from leveling after 56 unless you pay a lot of money to improve your team.  The DLC characters start at $20 to $30 just to unlock them.
45 minutes of reading before i could really do anything besides just click to move the story along. very p2w when to finally make it to your home.
Played first few min just a bunch of +18 content, rather play subnautica
gameplay is boring ðŸ’”
hot
hell no
ewwwww

You know that's a bad game when you see Nutaku's emblem on it. First of all, if you like to spend, this game is for you: The fap scenes, lewd skins and even the Oath mechanic are all paid. If you don't spend in game, then don't play it. It took a huge time to unlock the scenes, to max the waifus and unlock their lewd wallpapers. 
If you want a game to fap, play ArkRecode. BUt the EroLABS version, not the nuTRASHku =D
If you have played a few gacha games before you'll understand this game doesn't worth your time. There is no actual gameplay, boring leveling, and stupid story.

For a gacha game, this just isn't worth it. There are much better ones out there. The lewdness isn't that great either. The characters have one body type: boobs bigger than their heads.

The came also has convoluted system on top of convoluted system, which are all designed to have you open your wallet.

boring gacha game, feels like raid shadows with how many pop ups i got when first starting out with well over 100 bucks total, yeah i know there optional but just feels scummy since it has those fomo timers of "HEY DONT MISS THIS GREAT DEAL". overall not worth it since i was also spamed with a bunch of shit to catch up like wha.... felt very overwhelmed by it and its not common for me to get that way about games but this one did it
Played for 9 hours and did alot of story line and upgrades and after an update it deleted my whole account and progress.  I would not recommend especially if you are going to spend money in it.

The Newbie Event is the games tutorial, and you should make sure you are doing everything in that event, as most of the things it wants you to do (advance your Aeons, improve gear, improve your horoscope, level up your Apostle, etc) are all things that are critical to improving in the game, and you get a unique skin for Perseus if you complete enough tasks (you need 280 out of 295 points). This skin gives you a permanent power boost for owning it, and is permanently missable.
Once the Newbie Event ends you get the "14-Day Carnival" event, which is basically more of the same tasks.

The "Aeon Rally - Eternal" event gives you points for improving the rarity of your Aeons, with Corona Stones (i.e. Premium currency) for meeting certain milestones, and if you complete 2,500 points in time then you get a unique skin for Sphinx, which again gives you a permanent boost for owning it and is permanently missable.
Once Aeon Rally - Eternal ends, "Eternal Rally - Tennis Player" starts, which gives you a skin for Hypnos, which again, gives a power boost to your entire team and is permanently missable. The Hypnos event lasts 3 months.
The Sphinx skin is pretty difficult to do, and the Hypnos skin is very difficult to get unless you know exactly what you are doing, and both events generally require you to go for that skin only, only spending what you need, and buying up useful items from pretty much the moment you start playing.
If you play well (only buy what you need, always reclaim the energy itmem from the daily Andromeda event, complete all the event objectives as quickly as you can, don't lag behind in any area) you'll get them, but if you don't then you'll miss them.
Having fours events that basically require you to play very well right from the moment you start playing, or else miss permanently missable skins/power boosts is extremely poor game design, especially since those are the only skins you can reliably get as an f2p player.
It is often said on the games dicord that if you can't complete the Newbie event to get the Perseus skin then you should just start again on a different server so you can get it now that you know what to do, and the same is kinda true about the Sphinx skin too - they are permanent boosts that you can never get again, so if you actually want to play the game long-term then you should make the effort to get them whilst you can.
Personally, I image a lot of people will simply start the game, not play perfectly, fail the Newbie event, then see the 14-Day event and see they will fail that too, and just stop playing.
I also imagine there are many people who fail the Newbie event, look up a guide, start on a new server, complete the Newbie event, fail the Sphinx event, and then quit the game.


Aeons Echo is a good idle game, and a very good NSFW game.
If the skins from the beginner events were either not permanently missable, or the events were much easier, then I would happily recommend the game, but as it stands I just can't recommend a game that has a new player experience that is this bad.
Disgustingly bad network. Can't even enter the game at all thus losing out on dailies.

It's a P2W game. Not worth playing at all unless you want to drop hundreds of dollars in it to progress. Even if you did that, within a week you'll be behind again and need to spend more money to catch up. Everything about this game is a money grab.

Be aware of events! 

SO, I bought some gears/cogs/fancards, the ones that help you generate more points to unlock date events. 10$ + 3$ to extend the amount that help ramp up the points. 

Thought investing in those cogs/event generator points would carry over, maybe next event? It doesn't! Didn't even unlock all the stages, with the 13 dollars I invested. Because each event only gives you maybe a week or two.

Seems impossible unless you pay right away or are constantly checking in the game ever couple hours, even then, that's evil. 

Sadly no carry over! 

Made me realize, investing in this game has no real carry over. I've would've kept playing if it unlocked those features overtime and didn't reset over time. Not interested in spending hundreds of dollars to unlock content. Lovely art though.

The game finds about a hundred ways to waste my time with banal notifications that ultimately mean fuck all, since each one triggers 2 more things I have to go unlock and accept... and claim, and collect rewards, but none of it is worth anything. 7 summon banners? Really? And each one has a special currency that you get a single one of per day? 2 banners need incrementally increased costs, so... what's even the point? I'm not spending money on this, so you can just keep dreaming. Genuinely zero reason to pay anything for these cheap AI images of the same character, sporting a different snap-on head. Streamline this crap, or my interest will fall right off. I already didn't play for almost a week, and barely noticed. 

Red dot notifications often don't go away, since they're just flicking you in dick to spend money to make them go away. That shit is astoundingly frustrating. Even if you're coming here for some hentai (fucking... why? You're on the internet, you can look up whatever you want for free) the 18+ is even made tedious with loading times between dialogue options. Every aspect of this game is weighed down in SLOG, like trudging waist-deep through honey.
Gatcha style chain mail bikini fighting that stops you from leveling after 56 unless you pay a lot of money to improve your team.  The DLC characters start at $20 to $30 just to unlock them.

I enjoy good stories in game along with fun and challenging game play. However that's not the case here. This game auto-plays itself instead of you actually playing the game which was very disappointing. Cute cartoon babes are not enough to hold this game up. If I want to watch someone else play this or any other game I'll go to YouTube. A game that plays by itself while you watch is not a fun experience.

Trash game not because it a bad auto battler it probably one of the better ones, it because it reconnect to servers every 5 to 10 seconds and don't give me that shit like  "contact support" I have high end internet I shouldn't need to change shit on my end, fix your servers and I'll change my review.

Pros:
- The NSFW stuff which in the multitude of gacha games out there is quite uncommon unless you really look for it especially here in Steam.

Cons:
What I didn't like here is that the Login System seems to be broken (I logged in today to get the first bonus of the month which is a Star Key, but I checked my Summon page and found no Star Key). Another is that the Rewards page that shows once you boot the game is just stuck on Day 1 and never progresses. Both Login and Rewards are in an eternal state of being stuck with absolutely no way to get the prizes at all.

The mini-gachas. Oh my God, where do I start on this? The game is rigged in terms of the roulettes and others since I keep landing on worthless items (don't even dare tell me "F2P BTW" if you got better luck because you will never expect me to believe you're Free-To-Play, I'll think of you instead as "F*****-That-Pays"). All the events are expensive cash grabs.

Now for the Gacha system. This is the very first time I have ever seen an incredibly high prerequisite to unlock the better gachas, because not even Echocalypse had this kind of thing. Now, is this a good thing?

Ha. You'll wish it was a good thing, but no, it is literally the worst thing because you have no idea who's gonna be pulled, and you need to do 10-draw pulls 10 times (equaling 100 pulls) just so you can do a wishlist because the pity on this game is just the worst.

7.7 hours of this game played (yeah, I think I want those hours back except for that time I ran out of material). Little progress made.
45 minutes of reading before i could really do anything besides just click to move the story along. very p2w when to finally make it to your home.
It's your average predatory gacha game but I'm enough of a sucker for boobs that I'll probably keep "playing" and grabbing the daily free stuff for a while longer.
Played first few min just a bunch of +18 content, rather play subnautica
If you don't spend money, you will hardly ever see anything Adult in this Adult Only game.
There is close to no gameplay. This is just porn
complete trash. pure pay to win garbage
not a fan that you cant turn of sound for awhile
gameplay is boring ðŸ’”
not f2p friendly

You know that's a bad game when you see Nutaku's emblem on it. First of all, if you like to spend, this game is for you: The fap scenes, lewd skins and even the Oath mechanic are all paid. If you don't spend in game, then don't play it. It took a huge time to unlock the scenes, to max the waifus and unlock their lewd wallpapers. 
If you want a game to fap, play ArkRecode. BUt the EroLABS version, not the nuTRASHku =D
If you have played a few gacha games before you'll understand this game doesn't worth your time. There is no actual gameplay, boring leveling, and stupid story.

For a gacha game, this just isn't worth it. There are much better ones out there. The lewdness isn't that great either. The characters have one body type: boobs bigger than their heads.

The came also has convoluted system on top of convoluted system, which are all designed to have you open your wallet.

boring gacha game, feels like raid shadows with how many pop ups i got when first starting out with well over 100 bucks total, yeah i know there optional but just feels scummy since it has those fomo timers of "HEY DONT MISS THIS GREAT DEAL". overall not worth it since i was also spamed with a bunch of shit to catch up like wha.... felt very overwhelmed by it and its not common for me to get that way about games but this one did it
Played for 9 hours and did alot of story line and upgrades and after an update it deleted my whole account and progress.  I would not recommend especially if you are going to spend money in it.

TLDR:
There is an actual story that actually has some nice ideas here and there, the artwork is all very nice, the girls are all unique, there are plenty of ways of improving your team, there are plenty of things to do each day, but without taking excessively long to the point it starts to feel like a chore, the interface is not the worst. It's a shame the new player experience/tutorial is so horrendously awful that I imagine most players will probably quit long before they finish them.
If you either follow a guide so you do everything right for your first three months of playing, or just accept that you have missed out on several permanently-missable skins and power buffs, then it's a good NSFW idle auto-battler... that I do not recommend.


Overview

Story
The game has a story - it's an "amnesiac protagonist is suddenly in a harem world" as is expected for a NSFW idle game, but there is a lot of story there, and it has some good ideas and funny moments, and keeps moving and changing at a pretty good pace.
There's plenty to not like though, most notably the SA/rape and crossdressing aspects though (yes, really).

Combat
Combat is a 6x6 idle auto-battler. You set up your formation and your girls fight their girls.
Each girl has various stats, bonuses for being in formation with specific other girls, and there are goddesses that you can use alongside your formation.
Each girl in your team can also be upgraded in various ways (star level, rarity, gear, etc.) and there are other ways to buff your team.
There's a lot of ways to upgrade your girls, and the combat can be as simple as using the 6 girls you like the most, or you can give your formation a lot of thought to get the best possible team, so overall it feels like a decent combat system.

Also note that since each charater skin gives you a decent boost in power, whales who buy skins will be more powerful than f2p players, and since combat power determines turn order, whales will just outspeed and destroy f2p players, so the top of the PvP leaderboards are for whales only.
Thankfully whilst there are several f2p modes, you can still do decently well as an f2p (probably due to each server having a low population, probably due to the awful new player experience) and whilst you get more rewards the better you do, the difference in PvP rewards isn't much in the grand scheme of things.


NSFW
The game does have a lot of NSFW artwork in it, and almost all of it is animated to at least some extent.
The artwork is all very nice, and there is a wide variety of body types and poses to suit your preference.
You unlock quite a lot of scenes from the main story, you can view each girl on the games homescreen, there's usually an event going on that has some eye-candy as a reward.
Overall it's an extremel sexualized game, as expected for something that was originally on Nutaku.
(The Nutaku version is the same in terms of NSFW, but is ahead on content, so it has more girls available. The two versions can't crossplay or interact at all.)

Idle game
There are many things you can do each day - Play mini games, talk to Lilin, do some story, collect idle rewards from Styx, do Giant's Armory, do the PvP arenas, [if you log in at the right time each day] do guild events, maybe do some story, do some collections or pulls for the current event.
There's quite a lot to do, but it doesn't take an annoying or problematic amount of time, but it still feels like you are making a decent amount of progress each day.
Overall I'd say it's a pretty good idle game, albeit one that requires quite a lot of clicking.

Events
As above, the game always has several events running.
These vary considerably, but usually are either summoning for a new girl/skin, or a "do tasks to get rewards" type.
If you are f2p, you will never complete any of these events without many literal months of grinding resources.
Realistically, the only skins you will get as an f2p player are the three skins the game gives you for completing the newbie events that occur at the beginning of the game.
When you start the game you will immediately be given two events: "Newbie Event", which lasts 7 days, and "Aeon Rally - Eternal"
The Newbie Event is the games tutorial, and you should make sure you are doing everything in that event, as most of the things it wants you to do (advance your Aeons, improve gear, improve your horoscope, level up your Apostle, etc) are all things that are critical to improving in the game, and you get a unique skin for Perseus if you complete enough tasks (you need 280 out of 295 points). This skin gives you a permanent power boost for owning it, and is permanently missable.
Once the Newbie Event ends you get the "14-Day Carnival" event, which is basically more of the same tasks.

The "Aeon Rally - Eternal" event gives you points for improving the rarity of your Aeons, with Corona Stones (i.e. Premium currency) for meeting certain milestones, and if you complete 2,500 points in time then you get a unique skin for Sphinx, which again gives you a permanent boost for owning it and is permanently missable.
Once Aeon Rally - Eternal ends, "Eternal Rally - Tennis Player" starts, which gives you a skin for Hypnos, which again, gives a power boost to your entire team and is permanently missable. The Hypnos event lasts 3 months.
The Sphinx skin is pretty difficult to do, and the Hypnos skin is very difficult to get unless you know exactly what you are doing, and both events generally require you to go for that skin only, only spending what you need, and buying up useful items from pretty much the moment you start playing.
If you play well (only buy what you need, always reclaim the energy itmem from the daily Andromeda event, complete all the event objectives as quickly as you can, don't lag behind in any area) you'll get them, but if you don't then you'll miss them.
Having fours events that basically require you to play very well right from the moment you start playing, or else miss permanently missable skins/power boosts is extremely poor game design, especially since those are the only skins you can reliably get as an f2p player.
It is often said on the games dicord that if you can't complete the Newbie event to get the Perseus skin then you should just start again on a different server so you can get it now that you know what to do, and the same is kinda true about the Sphinx skin too - they are permanent boosts that you can never get again, so if you actually want to play the game long-term then you should make the effort to get them whilst you can.
Personally, I image a lot of people will simply start the game, not play perfectly, fail the Newbie event, then see the 14-Day event and see they will fail that too, and just stop playing.
I also imagine there are many people who fail the Newbie event, look up a guide, start on a new server, complete the Newbie event, fail the Sphinx event, and then quit the game.


Aeons Echo is a good idle game, and a very good NSFW game.
If the skins from the beginner events were either not permanently missable, or the events were much easier, then I would happily recommend the game, but as it stands I just can't recommend a game that has a new player experience that is this bad.
Disgustingly bad network. Can't even enter the game at all thus losing out on dailies.

Seems impossible unless you pay right away or are constantly checking in the game ever couple hours, even then, that's evil. 

Sadly no carry over! 

Made me realize, investing in this game has no real carry over. I've would've kept playing if it unlocked those features overtime and didn't reset over time. Not interested in spending hundreds of dollars to unlock content. Lovely art though.

Really? And each one has a special currency that you get a single one of per day? 2 banners need incrementally increased costs, so... what's even the point? I'm not spending money on this, so you can just keep dreaming. Genuinely zero reason to pay anything for these cheap AI images of the same character, sporting a different snap-on head. Streamline this crap, or my interest will fall right off. I already didn't play for almost a week, and barely noticed. 

Red dot notifications often don't go away, since they're just flicking you in dick to spend money to make them go away. That shit is astoundingly frustrating. Even if you're coming here for some hentai (fucking... why? You're on the internet, you can look up whatever you want for free) the 18+ is even made tedious with loading times between dialogue options. Every aspect of this game is weighed down in SLOG, like trudging waist-deep through honey.
Gatcha style chain mail bikini fighting that stops you from leveling after 56 unless you pay a lot of money to improve your team.  The DLC characters start at $20 to $30 just to unlock them.

I enjoy good stories in game along with fun and challenging game play. However that's not the case here. This game auto-plays itself instead of you actually playing the game which was very disappointing. Cute cartoon babes are not enough to hold this game up. If I want to watch someone else play this or any other game I'll go to YouTube. A game that plays by itself while you watch is not a fun experience.

Trash game not because it a bad auto battler it probably one of the better ones, it because it reconnect to servers every 5 to 10 seconds and don't give me that shit like  "contact support" I have high end internet I shouldn't need to change shit on my end, fix your servers and I'll change my review.

I'm not spending money on this, so you can just keep dreaming. Genuinely zero reason to pay anything for these cheap AI images of the same character, sporting a different snap-on head. Streamline this crap, or my interest will fall right off. I already didn't play for almost a week, and barely noticed. 

Red dot notifications often don't go away, since they're just flicking you in dick to spend money to make them go away. That shit is astoundingly frustrating. Even if you're coming here for some hentai (fucking... why? You're on the internet, you can look up whatever you want for free) the 18+ is even made tedious with loading times between dialogue options. Every aspect of this game is weighed down in SLOG, like trudging waist-deep through honey.
Gatcha style chain mail bikini fighting that stops you from leveling after 56 unless you pay a lot of money to improve your team.  The DLC characters start at $20 to $30 just to unlock them.

I enjoy good stories in game along with fun and challenging game play. However that's not the case here. This game auto-plays itself instead of you actually playing the game which was very disappointing. Cute cartoon babes are not enough to hold this game up. If I want to watch someone else play this or any other game I'll go to YouTube. A game that plays by itself while you watch is not a fun experience.

Trash game not because it a bad auto battler it probably one of the better ones, it because it reconnect to servers every 5 to 10 seconds and don't give me that shit like  "contact support" I have high end internet I shouldn't need to change shit on my end, fix your servers and I'll change my review.

Pros:
- The NSFW stuff which in the multitude of gacha games out there is quite uncommon unless you really look for it especially here in Steam.

Cons:
What I didn't like here is that the Login System seems to be broken (I logged in today to get the first bonus of the month which is a Star Key, but I checked my Summon page and found no Star Key). Another is that the Rewards page that shows once you boot the game is just stuck on Day 1 and never progresses. Both Login and Rewards are in an eternal state of being stuck with absolutely no way to get the prizes at all.

The mini-gachas. Oh my God, where do I start on this? The game is rigged in terms of the roulettes and others since I keep landing on worthless items (don't even dare tell me "F2P BTW" if you got better luck because you will never expect me to believe you're Free-To-Play, I'll think of you instead as "F*****-That-Pays"). All the events are expensive cash grabs.

Now for the Gacha system. This is the very first time I have ever seen an incredibly high prerequisite to unlock the better gachas, because not even Echocalypse had this kind of thing. Now, is this a good thing?

Ha. You'll wish it was a good thing, but no, it is literally the worst thing because you have no idea who's gonna be pulled, and you need to do 10-draw pulls 10 times (equaling 100 pulls) just so you can do a wishlist because the pity on this game is just the worst.

7.7 hours of this game played (yeah, I think I want those hours back except for that time I ran out of material). Little progress made.
45 minutes of reading before i could really do anything besides just click to move the story along. very p2w when to finally make it to your home.
It's your average predatory gacha game but I'm enough of a sucker for boobs that I'll probably keep "playing" and grabbing the daily free stuff for a while longer.

boring gacha game, feels like raid shadows with how many pop ups i got when first starting out with well over 100 bucks total, yeah i know there optional but just feels scummy since it has those fomo timers of "HEY DONT MISS THIS GREAT DEAL". overall not worth it since i was also spamed with a bunch of shit to catch up like wha.... felt very overwhelmed by it and its not common for me to get that way about games but this one did it
Played for 9 hours and did alot of story line and upgrades and after an update it deleted my whole account and progress.  I would not recommend especially if you are going to spend money in it.

TLDR:
There is an actual story that actually has some nice ideas here and there, the artwork is all very nice, the girls are all unique, there are plenty of ways of improving your team, there are plenty of things to do each day, but without taking excessively long to the point it starts to feel like a chore, the interface is not the worst. It's a shame the new player experience/tutorial is so horrendously awful that I imagine most players will probably quit long before they finish them.
If you either follow a guide so you do everything right for your first three months of playing, or just accept that you have missed out on several permanently-missable skins and power buffs, then it's a good NSFW idle auto-battler... that I do not recommend.


Overview

Story
The game has a story - it's an "amnesiac protagonist is suddenly in a harem world" as is expected for a NSFW idle game, but there is a lot of story there, and it has some good ideas and funny moments, and keeps moving and changing at a pretty good pace.
There's plenty to not like though, most notably the SA/rape and crossdressing aspects though (yes, really).

Combat
Combat is a 6x6 idle auto-battler. You set up your formation and your girls fight their girls.
Each girl has various stats, bonuses for being in formation with specific other girls, and there are goddesses that you can use alongside your formation.
Each girl in your team can also be upgraded in various ways (star level, rarity, gear, etc.) and there are other ways to buff your team.
There's a lot of ways to upgrade your girls, and the combat can be as simple as using the 6 girls you like the most, or you can give your formation a lot of thought to get the best possible team, so overall it feels like a decent combat system.

Also note that since each charater skin gives you a decent boost in power, whales who buy skins will be more powerful than f2p players, and since combat power determines turn order, whales will just outspeed and destroy f2p players, so the top of the PvP leaderboards are for whales only.
Thankfully whilst there are several f2p modes, you can still do decently well as an f2p (probably due to each server having a low population, probably due to the awful new player experience) and whilst you get more rewards the better you do, the difference in PvP rewards isn't much in the grand scheme of things.


NSFW
The game does have a lot of NSFW artwork in it, and almost all of it is animated to at least some extent.
The artwork is all very nice, and there is a wide variety of body types and poses to suit your preference.
You unlock quite a lot of scenes from the main story, you can view each girl on the games homescreen, there's usually an event going on that has some eye-candy as a reward.
Overall it's an extremel sexualized game, as expected for something that was originally on Nutaku.
(The Nutaku version is the same in terms of NSFW, but is ahead on content, so it has more girls available. The two versions can't crossplay or interact at all.)

Idle game
There are many things you can do each day - Play mini games, talk to Lilin, do some story, collect idle rewards from Styx, do Giant's Armory, do the PvP arenas, [if you log in at the right time each day] do guild events, maybe do some story, do some collections or pulls for the current event.
There's quite a lot to do, but it doesn't take an annoying or problematic amount of time, but it still feels like you are making a decent amount of progress each day.
Overall I'd say it's a pretty good idle game, albeit one that requires quite a lot of clicking.

Events
As above, the game always has several events running.
These vary considerably, but usually are either summoning for a new girl/skin, or a "do tasks to get rewards" type.
If you are f2p, you will never complete any of these events without many literal months of grinding resources.
Realistically, the only skins you will get as an f2p player are the three skins the game gives you for completing the newbie events that occur at the beginning of the game.
When you start the game you will immediately be given two events: "Newbie Event", which lasts 7 days, and "Aeon Rally - Eternal"
The Newbie Event is the games tutorial, and you should make sure you are doing everything in that event, as most of the things it wants you to do (advance your Aeons, improve gear, improve your horoscope, level up your Apostle, etc) are all things that are critical to improving in the game, and you get a unique skin for Perseus if you complete enough tasks (you need 280 out of 295 points). This skin gives you a permanent power boost for owning it, and is permanently missable.
Once the Newbie Event ends you get the "14-Day Carnival" event, which is basically more of the same tasks.

The "Aeon Rally - Eternal" event gives you points for improving the rarity of your Aeons, with Corona Stones (i.e. Premium currency) for meeting certain milestones, and if you complete 2,500 points in time then you get a unique skin for Sphinx, which again gives you a permanent boost for owning it and is permanently missable.
Once Aeon Rally - Eternal ends, "Eternal Rally - Tennis Player" starts, which gives you a skin for Hypnos, which again, gives a power boost to your entire team and is permanently missable. The Hypnos event lasts 3 months.
The Sphinx skin is pretty difficult to do, and the Hypnos skin is very difficult to get unless you know exactly what you are doing, and both events generally require you to go for that skin only, only spending what you need, and buying up useful items from pretty much the moment you start playing.
If you play well (only buy what you need, always reclaim the energy itmem from the daily Andromeda event, complete all the event objectives as quickly as you can, don't lag behind in any area) you'll get them, but if you don't then you'll miss them.
Having fours events that basically require you to play very well right from the moment you start playing, or else miss permanently missable skins/power boosts is extremely poor game design, especially since those are the only skins you can reliably get as an f2p player.
It is often said on the games dicord that if you can't complete the Newbie event to get the Perseus skin then you should just start again on a different server so you can get it now that you know what to do, and the same is kinda true about the Sphinx skin too - they are permanent boosts that you can never get again, so if you actually want to play the game long-term then you should make the effort to get them whilst you can.
Personally, I image a lot of people will simply start the game, not play perfectly, fail the Newbie event, then see the 14-Day event and see they will fail that too, and just stop playing.
I also imagine there are many people who fail the Newbie event, look up a guide, start on a new server, complete the Newbie event, fail the Sphinx event, and then quit the game.


Aeons Echo is a good idle game, and a very good NSFW game.
If the skins from the beginner events were either not permanently missable, or the events were much easier, then I would happily recommend the game, but as it stands I just can't recommend a game that has a new player experience that is this bad.
Disgustingly bad network. Can't even enter the game at all thus losing out on dailies.

It's a P2W game. Not worth playing at all unless you want to drop hundreds of dollars in it to progress. Even if you did that, within a week you'll be behind again and need to spend more money to catch up. Everything about this game is a money grab.

Be aware of events! 

SO, I bought some gears/cogs/fancards, the ones that help you generate more points to unlock date events. 10$ + 3$ to extend the amount that help ramp up the points. 

Thought investing in those cogs/event generator points would carry over, maybe next event? It doesn't! Didn't even unlock all the stages, with the 13 dollars I invested. Because each event only gives you maybe a week or two.

Seems impossible unless you pay right away or are constantly checking in the game ever couple hours, even then, that's evil. 

Sadly no carry over! 

Made me realize, investing in this game has no real carry over. I've would've kept playing if it unlocked those features overtime and didn't reset over time. Not interested in spending hundreds of dollars to unlock content. Lovely art though.
